message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The inability to move the right arm, limited wrist flexion and extension, and decreased sensation along the thumb suggest a nerve injury. The crepitus above the elbow upon movement suggests a fracture. Among the options, the most likely diagnosis is a supracondular humerus fracture, which can cause nerve damage and limited wrist flexion and extension, as well as crepitus. The other options do not typically cause nerve damage in the thumb.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The inability to move the arm, crepitus and decreased sensation along with the inability to make the "OK" sign suggest a supracondular humerus fracture. Other options would have different symptoms and findings.

The most likely diagnosis is Supracondular humerus fracture, which can cause both median nerve injury and crepitus when there is elbow movement.
